𓄿 Adler Attila aquilla eagle 𓅂 'tywr? ≈ 𒅕𒌅𒌒𒉿𒄿𒀀 'tupia®

𓄿 aquilla eagle ≈ 𓅥 𓅣 igira #igirû 𒆠𒊕𒊩𒄷;𒉌𒄄𒊏𒄷;𒆠𒊕𒊩·(𒆠𒅗𒊩)𒄷;𒄿𒄀𒊏𒄷

𓄿 Aar < ἄρξιφος árxiphos ἄρζιφος árziphos 𐬆𐬭𐬆𐬰𐬌𐬟𐬌𐬌𐬀 ərəzifiia 𒅕𒌅𒌒𒉿𒄿𒀀 ir-tup-pi-ia 𓄿𓅂 Aar'tywr Hr̥ȷ́ipyás “eagle”

𓄿𓅂 արծիվ ɑɾծiv Aar.tyw 𓅂 طير ṭīr 🐦 Tier 𓅂𓄿

𓄿 akbaba: (white)vulture

𓄿 VUL/VOL/FAL Valkyrie 𓄿 𓎡 𓂋 𓆙 @ Valhalla völva

In old German Aar means eagle.
In many European countries AIR or variants means air (aero).
In Egypt the sign 𓄿 which has a reconstructed sound similar to 'air' also has the meaning eagle and air.

Adel Aar vs al'air lair (AdLer, Lerche(lark), … vs 𓄿𓅮𓅯𓇋Luft)

𓄿 𒄩𒀀𒊏𒀸 ḫāras Earth & Nature 𓈖𓏏𓂋𓏯𓅐 ⲛⲟϣⲉⲣ = vulture / eagle

𓄿 h₃érōⁿ “eagle” (𒄷 ḪUʳ mušen suffix ommitted) :
